title: Entree #2
quote of the day: pork: 'no im like tossing 'sense' onto the ground and pointing it out'
content:
pork is like an alternative universe version of me the version of myself that speaks to me if 16 year old me could speak to me now.
 I work at a golf course to understand rich people; I do debate i out aura them; im leagues beyond my peers; im persistent and smart from a young age; etc;
 if you dont need people than stop needing them
 as edward put it 'dont really on the sunk cost fallacy'.
 this is simple shit i do know but i forget a lot. but again dont be too hard on yourself. consistent effort is 100 times more powerful than a single larger push

title: Entree #3
quote of the day: constraints are more powerful than goals
content: antigoals are as important if not more important than goals. people work better when they work freely within a constrained system rather than in a single direction. its impossible to know where to go in an ever evolving world so constraints - even if artificial and arbitrary allow for more novel solutions to emerge than the hyper specificity of a single goal

quote of the day: look at youself as a stalker
content: to move on and for growth to happen i need to look at myself as a stalker. dave was talking about not becoming to obsessed over analyiss of past and i think this relates to that. perhaps the method for moving out of your brain and moving ones self into a state that the intenal emotiona feel more comfortable in you need to treat yourself as a character and judge accordingly. like gracie says you are not 'you mind you are the thing that watches your mind'. like arthur says 'our internal thoughts might just be long winded justifiycations for irrational emotions but acting upon them regardless is important because what else are you to do to derive meaning. (he didnt say that exactly but im approximating what he said)' I think its important that I learn to stop overanalysisng my state internally and start observing from an external view. 'the easiest way to stop depersonalisation is to stop researching depersonalisation' 'stop thinking in the mindset of better luck next time and more in the mindset of i am built for this and not for this' 'the most successful founders are those who move quickly and continously have a drive to test new ideas; those who can think of new ideas frequently while also testing them do best.' i asked dave about the shopify founders advice 'work a hard job but not for too long that you become complacement; hire people in otawa they ahve nothing else to do' Sources: https://www.instagram.com/p/DAoujD-S6BO/ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b-xjLSNdu2w&list=PLJ_iA72MtEwM-eGSMmAS59VcGK2P0hoKo https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=szKyUrOh4fs
